comments:
Build ID: 200702150621

Steps To Reproduce:
Use following code to execute a file with CDT Spawner

ProcessFactory factory = ProcessFactory.getFactory();
Process process = factory.exec(commandArray, environment, workDir);
if (! (process instanceof Spawner)) {
   throw new Exception("CDT does not support Spawner on this platform");
}
process.waitFor();

Try to run (as non root user) a file that is executable, but not readable, like:

$ ls -la /opt/.../bin/file
---x--x--x 1 root root 4396 2007-03-20 13:18 /opt/.../bin/file

The process will not be created and following exception will be thrown: "Exec error:Cannot run /opt/ibm/systemsim-cell/bin/snif"
Unable to find full path for "/opt/ibm/systemsim-cell/bin/snif"
java.io.IOException: Exec error:Cannot run /opt/ibm/systemsim-cell/bin/snif
	at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.Spawner.exec(Spawner.java:243)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.Spawner.<init>(Spawner.java:57)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.Spawner.<init>(Spawner.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.ProcessFactory.exec(ProcessFactory.java:65)
...

Additionally, following message is printed on stderr:
Unable to find full path for "/opt/.../bin/file"

Setting the +r flags on the file solves the problem.

The file can be executed from command line. The file can be executed with Runtime.getRuntime().exec(...).

Since Spawner extends java.lang.Process, it would be reasonable to expect that a file that can be executed with Process should also be able to be executed with Spawner, since Spawner extends Process.

Some files (specially files with suid) may be packaged and installed without read permissions.

More information:
$ uname -a
